races.name: Claims Care Supporting Hospice At Home Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
races.verdict:
A few of these can go forward, including BEL AMIGO who landed a hat-trick in novice hurdles at this track last season and has solid claims of maintaining his perfect course record after a more encouraging third at Perth last month. Blue Fin made a winning reappearance in this race last year and is expected to go well again off a break, while King Ulanda could be worth another chance on first start since wind surgery and may prove the beneficiary if the pace is strong.

  1. BEL AMIGO (FR)
  2. BLUE FIN (IRE)
  3. KING ULANDA (IRE)

races.name: David Allen 'Chasing Excellence' Beginners' Chase (GBB Race)
races.verdict:
Not the easiest race to assess and useful winning hurdler PUSH THE BUTTON is taken to go in at the first time of asking in this sphere starting out for Mark Walford. Both Ruby Island and Tellherthename also bring lots of potential to fences and can chase home the selection in that order.

  1. PUSH THE BUTTON (IRE)
  2. RUBY ISLAND
  3. TELLHERTHENAME (IRE)

races.name: Davy Plastering Supporting Hospice At Home Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
races.verdict:
This could be a good opportunity for Point winner CAVE BRIDGE to make a winning start over hurdles for Harry Derham. Ryebridge drops back in trip following a much improved effort when runner-up over 2Â½m but still commands plenty of respect in a winnable maiden, particularly if the market speaks in his favour. Aeroplane Blonde did plenty wrong when fourth at Uttoxeter but that form has worked out well and he could be a threat if putting it all together over a longer trip following another break.

  1. CAVE BRIDGE (IRE)
  2. RYEBRIDGE (IRE)
  3. AEROPLANE BLONDE

races.name: Vesta Wealth Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
races.verdict:
It's impossible to rule any of these out nor recommend any with wholehearted confidence. YOUR OWN STORY didn't exactly end last term on a high, but a reproduction of either of his efforts in staying handicaps at Kelso or his sixth-placed finish in the Welsh National would give him a serious chance off this mark. Jet Legs' profile is not entirely dissimilar and he is feared most, though Dare To Shout goes well fresh and also has claims, along with in-form veteran Almazhar Garde.

  1. YOUR OWN STORY (IRE)
  2. JET LEGS (IRE)
  3. DARE TO SHOUT

races.name: JJ Group Contracting Handicap Hurdle
races.verdict:
This is wide open so it could pay to side with Micky Hammond's lightly-raced LIVANO BELLO who ended last season with a career-best third at Market Rasen and returns on the back of wind surgery with Brian Hughes again in the saddle. Unpenalised Kelso scorer Looking Splendid rates a major threat with Blazing Court, Born In The West and Kuzco all in the picture too.

  1. LIVANO BELLO (FR)
  2. LOOKING SPLENDID
  3. BLAZING COURT (IRE)

races.name: Eddie Wannop Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
races.verdict:
None of these can be ruled out but ALSHADHIAN has race fitness on his side and is taken to resume winning ways on the back of a very good Worcester second. The returning Realisation rates a big threat though off a handy-looking mark with 2023 victor Hello Judge and the reliable Busty Boy also well in the mix.

  1. ALSHADHIAN (IRE)
  2. REALISATION (FR)
  3. HELLO JUDGE

races.name: Margaret Long Memorial Open NH Flat Race (GBB Race)
races.verdict:
NOBOTHERATALL went close at Kelso last month and looks the way to go having made a good start in this sphere. Point winner Frankies Fortune and Siege of Acres are appealing newcomers.

  1. NOBOTHERATALL (IRE)
  2. FRANKIES FORTUNE (IRE)
  3. SIEGE OF ACRES (FR)

races.name: Star Sports Brighton Owners Series Handicap
races.verdict:
STATE OF MADNESS was impressive when bolting up over C&D nine days ago, seeing off several re-opposing rivals despite hanging left, and he can follow up under a penalty for his excellent young trainer. Fai Fai has been ultra-consistent at this track with three placed efforts from three starts here this year and looks the main danger. Grovely Belle is another to consider.

  1. STATE OF MADNESS
  2. FAI FAI
  3. GROVELY BELLE (IRE)

races.name: Star Sports We Believe In Bookmaking EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
races.verdict:
PEROLA shaped very encouragingly when a close second at Kempton just 15 days ago, particularly as denied a clear passage and he looks ready to go one better here. Boss Lady showed promise in her first two starts before a weaker effort on the all-weather and this return to turf and 6f should help her cause. Havana Jag represents a yard that does well with juveniles so is a newcomer of some interest.

  1. PEROLA (FR)
  2. BOSS LADY (IRE)
  3. HAVANA JAG

races.name: Star Sports EBF 'Confined' Restricted Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
races.verdict:
ONLY IN MANILA shaped nicely after a tardy start when second at Southwell 3 weeks ago and sure to be more streetwise this time, he looks the way to go. Magical Merlot and Quarter are the obvious threats.

  1. ONLY IN MANILA
  2. MAGICAL MERLOT
  3. QUARTER (IRE)

races.name: Starsports.Bet Handicap
races.verdict:
JOYCEAN WAY has been knocking on the door with four near misses in his last five starts, beaten by a length or less each time. Unlucky not to collect over C&D 31 days ago after charting a wide passage in the straight, he looks ready to finally break his duck. Tenbob Tommy, runner-up here 17 days ago, represents the main danger, while OJ Lifestyle has previous C&D success and is now back on his last winning mark.

  1. JOYCEAN WAY
  2. TENBOB TOMMY
  3. OJ LIFESTYLE (IRE)

races.name: Parkfield Equine Solutions Handicap
races.verdict:
MC'TED impressed when making all at Wolverhampton on stable debut and can follow up under a penalty at a track where he's previously run well. Birthday Angel got off the mark decisively over C&D nine days ago and is respected, while Galactic Glow can remain competitive,

  1. MC'TED
  2. BIRTHDAY ANGEL (IRE)
  3. GALACTIC GLOW (IRE)

races.name: Docker Hughes Memorial Handicap
races.verdict:
A PINT OF BEAR almost snapped a lengthy losing sequence here last week and eased 2 lb since, his claims from a handicapping perspective seem fairly obvious. Starsong is a reliable operator at this level and is feared most, ahead Poetic Force.

  1. A PINT OF BEAR (IRE)
  2. STARSONG (IRE)
  3. POETIC FORCE (IRE)

races.name: Buzz Bingo Full House Handicap
races.verdict:
ALSHIMALI can have a line put through his run behind Barnsnape Boy over C&D in August and freshened up since, he's taken to get back on the up. That aforementioned rival should be a factor again, along with Libra Tiger, who also ties in with the selection.

  1. ALSHIMALI (IRE)
  2. BARNSNAPE BOY
  3. LIBRA TIGER

races.name: Herbert R Thomas Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
races.verdict:
CALME OLYMPIEN has shown fairly useful form in France and has to be considered the one to beat on his UK/stable debut, though strong market support for successful Irish pointer Minella Apprentice would put a slightly different slant on matters.

  1. CALME OLYMPIEN (FR)
  2. MINELLA APPRENTICE (IRE)
  3. FAIRLAWN SKIPPER

races.name: JCP Solicitors Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
races.verdict:
ANOTHER LORD got back on the up in the style of one who'll go on to even better things at Uttoxeter last month, so he's fancied to see off the Evan Williams-trained pair.

  1. ANOTHER LORD (IRE)
  2. NEO KING (FR)
  3. PUDDLESINTHEPARK (IRE)

races.name: Ethical Packaging Novices' Handicap Chase
races.verdict:
Former point winner ROE AND CO may well leave his low-key maiden hurdle form a long way behind now switched to fences for the bang in-form Jamie Snowden yard. It will look sigificant if there's support for him in the ring and the 7-y-o gets the nod ahead of Mini Fortune and Imperial Measure.

  1. ROE AND CO (IRE)
  2. MINI FORTUNE (IRE)
  3. IMPERIAL MEASURE (IRE)

races.name: RWK Goodman Handicap Hurdle
races.verdict:
MELTON MOSSY shaped better than the bare result over a trip too far at Chepstow (23.6f) on his final outing and given he's capable fresh, he's taken to make a winning return back down in distance. The Longest Day proved he retains ability when a creditable third at Newton Abbot on his recent comeback and is second choice.

  1. MELTON MOSSY (IRE)
  2. THE LONGEST DAY (IRE)
  3. ORDER OF THE DANCE (IRE)

races.name: Sigma 3 Kitchens & Bedrooms Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
races.verdict:
There should be better to come from AT THE OCHE, who pulled well clear of the rest when second to a race-fit rival on his hurdles debut last month and he should go one better this time. Point winner Elusive Knight looks the pick of the Evan Williams-trained trio judged on jockey bookings and he is preferred to stablemates Getarose and Minella Mania for forecast purposes.

  1. AT THE OCHE (IRE)
  2. ELUSIVE KNIGHT (IRE)
  3. GETAROSE (IRE)

races.name: Faucets Handicap Hurdle
races.verdict:
GAVIN has plenty in his favour here and is fancied to record another C&D success. Turpin Gold has had a productive season for Tom Lacey and is feared most if back to his best, while Estate Planning isn't one for maximum faith but did run well to finish third on his sole previous start at this track.

  1. GAVIN
  2. TURPIN GOLD
  3. ESTATE PLANNING (IRE)

races.name: Bear Hotel Handicap Hurdle
races.verdict:
WEAVER'S ANSWER posted some good efforts last season, including when third in a race at Taunton backed up by the timefigure on his final outing, so he earns the vote having gone well fresh before. Isle of Sark seemed revitalised by a first-time visor when scoring at Sedgefield last week and is much respected under a 7-lb penalty, with Wolfspear also feared.

  1. WEAVER'S ANSWER
  2. ISLE OF SARK (USA)
  3. WOLFSPEAR (IRE)

races.name: Flutter Proudly Supporting Pancreatic Cancer UK 'Confined' EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
races.verdict:
Well-bred NOBLE JOURNEY made a promising start at Newmarket and can open his account with improvement coming over this longer trip. Sea And Sun is an appealing newcomer and it will be interesting to see strength behind him in the betting.

  1. NOBLE JOURNEY
  2. SEA AND SUN
  3. AROUSE (IRE)

races.name: Betfair Exchange Beacons Nursery
races.verdict:
MAD UNICORN can follow up Saturday's Wolverhampton success from Redditizio, who seems sure to be bang there again. Beach Partee and American Flight are also in the hunt.

  1. MAD UNICORN
  2. REDDITIZIO (IRE)
  3. BEACH PARTEE

races.name: 'Timeform Sprint Series Qualifier' Handicap (Div 1)
races.verdict:
FANTASY MASTER ran creditably in a stronger Ascot race 12 days ago and could be worth chancing from a tempting mark having won on his last go over C&D. The unexposed Cherry Cobbler is interesting, while Abbey Heights has good all-weather form and might figure if getting an early lead.

  1. FANTASY MASTER
  2. CHERRY COBBLER
  3. ABBEY HEIGHTS

races.name: 'Timeform Sprint Series Qualifier' Handicap (Div 2)
races.verdict:
EVENING SAIGON makes his handicap debut after a lengthy absence but remains potentially a useful sprinter if all is well and could be worth chancing. C&D winner Mesaafi is feared, while The Thames Boatman should be rattling home.

  1. EVENING SAIGON (IRE)
  2. MESAAFI
  3. THE THAMES BOATMAN

races.name: Play Different With Betfair Handicap
races.verdict:
KITARO KICH has been a model of consistency on the all-weather and his excellent second at Kempton last week suggests he's primed to go one better back at this favoured venue. Giant continues in good heart having finished runner-up over C&D just seven days ago, while Mister Mojito could show more back here.

  1. KITARO KICH (IRE)
  2. GIANT
  3. MISTER MOJITO (IRE)

races.name: Bet At Your Best With Betfair Handicap
races.verdict:
MATCH ANTHEM lurks on a good mark and could resume winning ways. Edergole's Gift has been in good form recently with a win and two seconds in her last five starts and can go close if perhaps settling better. Saidha might have a small handicap like this in her.

  1. MATCH ANTHEM (IRE)
  2. EDERGOLE'S GIFT (IRE)
  3. SAIDHA

races.name: Betfair Racing Podcasts Handicap
races.verdict:
MORTE POINT has been thriving at 7f, winning at Newbury before an excellent Doncaster second when headed only in the final strides. He remains unexposed and looks ready to strike again. Fire Flame won well at Thirsk in August and was unlucky when meeting trouble at Yarmouth recently. He's a big player, while Arctic Grey could figure returned to AW.

  1. MORTE POINT
  2. FIRE FLAME
  3. ARCTIC GREY (IRE)

races.name: Betfair Safer Gambling Tools Handicap
races.verdict:
MY BOY HARRY was perked up by a visor when scoring at Kempton last week and can defy a penalty to follow up. Kessaar Power and Iftikhaar could both return to form back at Chelmsford and are feared.

  1. MY BOY HARRY
  2. KESSAAR POWER (IRE)
  3. IFTIKHAAR (IRE)

races.name: betting.betfair.com Handicap
races.verdict:
WYLD BILL has been in excellent form recently and looks well placed to win again. Masqool is the big threat, while Hoornblower could feature if his stamina holds out.

  1. WYLD BILL
  2. MASQOOL (IRE)
  3. HOORNBLOWER

races.name: Arc All-Weather 1MILLION Bonus Returns Handicap
races.verdict:
Lightly-raced 3-y-o CAPTAIN PARMA took a sizeable step forward on his first start since being gelded when going close at Chelmsford a fortnight ago and, with a 2 lb rise for that fair, he can go one better this time. Highland Olly is feared most, with Fistral Beach and Tiempo Alegre both accorded respect given their records round here.

  1. CAPTAIN PARMA (IRE)
  2. HIGHLAND OLLY
  3. FISTRAL BEACH (IRE)

races.name: Free Race Replays On attheraces.com EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
races.verdict:
WE'RE GOOSERS shaped encouragingly when second in a Newmarket maiden that is typically worth noting and he's fancied to go one better here. King's Trust was fourth in a much stronger maiden on debut and could prove the main danger if bouncing back in first-time headgear following a gelding operation. Newcomer Amber Hamur makes appeal on paper and is one to note for support.

  1. WE'RE GOOSERS (IRE)
  2. KING'S TRUST
  3. AMBER HAMUR (IRE)

races.name: attheraces.com/marketmovers Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
races.verdict:
ROGUE CITATION shaped well when third on debut at Carlisle and she looks the one to beat following a short break. Bushwacker is a good-looking type and should make more of an impact back in novice company, while Starlit City looks sure to appreciate the step up to 6f following his promising debut third.

  1. ROGUE CITATION (IRE)
  2. BUSHWACKER (IRE)
  3. STARLIT CITY (IRE)

races.name: Arc 1MILLION Bonus Bigger Than Ever Fillies' Handicap
races.verdict:
PURPLE RAINBOW was clearly held in high regard earlier in her career and looks worth another chance back up in trip with a first-time tongue strap fitted. Jakarta probably would have won had she kept straighter at Newmarket last time and makes appeal off the same mark, while lightly-raced Summer Heat is respected arriving on the back of her best effort to date.

  1. PURPLE RAINBOW
  2. JAKARTA
  3. SUMMER HEAT

races.name: Download The At The Races App Handicap
races.verdict:
FIRE EYES can race off the same mark as when a very good recent C&D second so looks the way to go here. Have You A Minute is feared most on the back of a Wolverhampton victory with Jazz Scene and Rusheen Boy also in the mix.

  1. FIRE EYES (FR)
  2. HAVE YOU A MINUTE
  3. JAZZ SCENE

races.name: Free Tips Daily On attheraces.com Handicap
races.verdict:
In-form maiden NAVAL ENSIGN comes here on the back of a very good Yarmouth second so gets the vote at the chief expense of Southwell runner-up Atomic Mass. Lucius Aurelius, Fancy Dancer and Addarella can all have a say too in this competitive handicap.

  1. NAVAL ENSIGN (IRE)
  2. ATOMIC MASS (IRE)
  3. LUCIUS AURELIUS

races.name: attheraces.com/marketmovers Handicap
races.verdict:
BALGOWAN was nearer last than first at Salisbury last time, but he is of strong interest off a workable mark now returned to the all-weather. Having found just one too good on two of her last three starts, Inlet is likely to have a say in the finish and she is next on the list ahead of Belaya River and handicap debutant Lahire.

  1. BALGOWAN (IRE)
  2. INLET
  3. BELAYA RIVER (FR)

races.name: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Handicap
races.verdict:
HICKTON deservedly got his head in front at Hamilton recently and, armed with a good attitude, he looks capable of following up off this 3 lb higher mark. Fellow last-time-out winner Weegeebear should have a significant role to play, while My Brother Mike and Takteek both make some each-way appeal.

  1. HICKTON (IRE)
  2. WEEGEEBEAR (IRE)
  3. MY BROTHER MIKE (IRE)

races.name: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (Smullen Series)
races.verdict:
ARDAD NED made a promising start at Navan last week and can open his account with improvement on the way. Aravalli might be the pick of the newcomers, while Acclamatic sets the standard.

  1. ARDAD NED (IRE)
  2. ARAVALLI (IRE)
  3. ACCLAMATIC (IRE)

races.name: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden
races.verdict:
STARRED took a big step forward when third in a big-field maiden over C&D last time and gets a confident vote to open his account now. Ger Lyons' Invincible Army newcomer Silk Braid could emerge as the main danger with Port Arthur, Goofy Gander and Lumiere Des Etoile appealing as the pick of the rest.

  1. STARRED (IRE)
  2. SILK BRAID (IRE)
  3. PORT ARTHUR (IRE)

races.name: DNG Handicap
races.verdict:
A case can be made for a few of these but STAYSOUND SUSIE took a big step back in the right direction when fourth at Cork recently and can now capitalise on a lenient mark. Unique Journey and Gerrit's Gem fought out a good finish over C&D last time and should be right in the mix again. Sarahmae completes the shortlist.

  1. STAYSOUND SUSIE (IRE)
  2. UNIQUE JOURNEY (IRE)
  3. GERRIT'S GEM (IRE)

races.name: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Apprentice Handicap
races.verdict:
The drop back to this trip is unlikely to be an issue for MICKEY THE STEEL, who was a solid third over 6f here recently and, on that evidence, he looks capable of cashing in on this attractive mark. Distillate will be a threat if on-song, while Nouvel Espoir and Steel Mango, both of whom found just one too good late time, are others to consider.

  1. MICKEY THE STEEL
  2. DISTILLATE
  3. NOUVEL ESPOIR (IRE)

races.name: DNG Handicap
races.verdict:
IN MY TEENS appeals as a likely improver now switched to handicap company so is fancied to quickly resume winning ways. Tipperary scorer Grey Leader is next on the list ahead of Retracement, Coeur D'Or and Isambard Brunel.

  1. IN MY TEENS (IRE)
  2. GREY LEADER (IRE)
  3. RETRACEMENT (IRE)

races.name: Final Furlong Podcast With 1xbet.ie Maiden
races.verdict:
There is more to come from APPEARED and Aidan O'Brien's charge could be the way to go in a trappy maiden. Portnahapple made a promising start here 3 weeks ago and can improve up in trip, with Carthusian and Generous Support completing the shortlist.

  1. APPEARED (USA)
  2. PORTNAHAPPLE
  3. CARTHUSIAN (IRE)

races.name: DNG Gold Handicap
races.verdict:
This is wide open but the vote goes to FAR ECLIPSE who comes here on the up and is taken to gain his breakthrough success at the chief expense of the handily-weighted duo Imarajan and Makaiah. Trubshaw, Grann's Boy and Lady Kai all command plenty of respect too.

  1. FAR ECLIPSE (IRE)
  2. IMARAJAN (IRE)
  3. MAKAIAH (IRE)

races.name: 1xbet.ie Supports Irish Racing Handicap
races.verdict:
Though below par the last twice, the veteran VERHOYEN has slipped to a dangerous mark and will have every chance if reproducing form such as his close third in a big-field Naas handicap in August. Prime Sign shaped as though the return to this trip would be ideal when sixth in a 6f Naas handicap on her latest start in May and she still has low mileage. The Andrew Oliver-trained filly is second choice ahead of recent Bellewstown winner Mogwli and Zipster.

  1. VERHOYEN
  2. PRIME SIGN (IRE)
  3. MOGWLI (IRE)

races.name: Thurles Mares Maiden Hurdle
races.verdict:
QUALIMITA was placed in stronger maidens than this last season and may be able to make a winning return. Run For Mahler had solid form in bumpers and should improve from her hurdling debut, as should Henry De Bromhead's Stepdance. Gangster Granny is one to note for support on her hurdling bow.

  1. QUALIMITA (FR)
  2. RUN FOR MAHLER (IRE)
  3. STEPDANCE (IRE)

races.name: Leugh Handicap Hurdle (0-100)
races.verdict:
CENTAQ has been knocking on the door with consecutive runner-up finishes at Downpatrick and is taken to go one better if the likely strong pace materialises. The Border Boy returned to form when third at Fairyhouse just five days ago and has claims if he can build on that, while Wing Back may well get back on track if none the worse for his recent fall. Redcliff Glen is one to note in the betting.

  1. CENTAQ (IRE)
  2. THE BORDER BOY (IRE)
  3. WING BACK (IRE)

races.name: Moyne Rated Novice Hurdle
races.verdict:
TASSAROLO progressed again when runner-up at Killarney earlier this month and has leading claims if seeing out the longer trip. Nelson Muntz finished 4Â½ lengths behind Tassarolo last time but could improve for the step up to 2Â½m, while Lambay Island looks interesting upped in distance on handicap debut.

  1. TASSAROLO
  2. NELSON MUNTZ (IRE)
  3. LAMBAY ISLAND (IRE)

races.name: www.thurlesraces.ie Maiden Hurdle
races.verdict:
Not a strong maiden by any means and it affords ADDITIONAL TIME a good chance to build on a mildly-promising hurdles bow at Wexford. Heron's Butler was in the process of showing much-improved form until unseating his rider at Clonmel and he's the obvious threat, ahead of Tsavo Park.

  1. ADDITIONAL TIME (IRE)
  2. HERON'S BUTLER (IRE)
  3. TSAVO PARK (IRE)

races.name: www.thurlesraces.ie Hurdle
races.verdict:
HEWICK has loftier targets this season but this looks a good starting point for him. Run For Oscar is the obvious threat.

  1. HEWICK (IRE)
  2. RUN FOR OSCAR (IRE)
  3. MOON D'ORANGE (FR)

races.name: Premier County Mares Handicap Hurdle (0-100)
races.verdict:
In a wide-open handicap, SIUL MOLLY SIUL is taken to bounce back from her fall at Cork, having previously looked the type do to better over this sort of distance in handicaps. Hob's Angel hasn't progressed over fences but has claims on the best of her hurdles form from earlier this year, while Milanaway should be more competitive following her recent reappearance.

  1. SIUL MOLLY SIUL (IRE)
  2. HOB'S ANGEL (IRE)
  3. MILANAWAY (IRE)

races.name: Munster Flat Race
races.verdict:
A thin bumper and a very good opportunity for GET IT GIRL to make a successful start for Willie Mullins. Gavin Cromwell's Press The Button might be the danger.

  1. GET IT GIRL (IRE)
  2. PRESS THE BUTTON (IRE)
  3. LONG GOODBYE (FR)

races.name: Prix Hommage A Guy Foiret - Attele
Prix Des Amis De L'hippodrome - Attele
Prix De La Ville De Barjouville - Attele
Prix De La Ville Du Coudray - Attele
Prix De La Porte Saint-denis - Monte
Prix De La Porte De La Chapelle - Attele
Des Boucles De La Seine Handicap

nextTenRaces.betting_forecast: She Rules (6/5), Turkoman (5/1), Shock And Awe (5/1), Noble Pursuit (8/1), Lead Singer (8/1), Southernaristocrat (8/1), The Whispering (12/1), Article Fifteen (12/1), Feronia (14/1), Armament (16/1), Exemplary Blues (20/1)

owner.name: Mr B P Devaraja And Mr K S Kiran
Mrs Deepa Devaney And Mr Sathish Kumar Joghee

race_summary.name: Original Vel Racing Trophy Handicap Div 2

nextTenRaces.betting_forecast: Sea Of Adventure (6/5), Serai (11/8), Sparkling Night (12/1), Sheeba (12/1), Ignorance Is Bliss (12/1), Thewhisperquietly (12/1), Biometric (12/1), Choice (14/1)

owner.name: Mr K K Belliappa, Mr Harmeet Singh Chhabra And Mr Pallon S Mistry Rep Manjri Horse Breeders Farm Pvt Ltd

nextTenRaces.betting_forecast: True Punch (5/4), Ladylion (5/2), Little Minister (5/1), Sir Calculus (8/1), Rapidus (12/1), Miraculous Girl (12/1), Ultimate Blues (12/1), Reign Of Terror (12/1)

owner.name: Mr K S Mandanna And Mr M Raghunath

race_summary.name: Prix Hommage A Guy Foiret - Attele

nextTenRaces.betting_forecast: Joie Gibus (4/1), Iloulou Jasma (5/1), John Angot (6/1), Hequileo Jiel (10/1), Ilda De Bertrange (11/1), Histoire De Lierre (15/1), Joyeux Meslois (16/1), Hidao De La Goutte (20/1), Jim De Suce (22/1), Indra De Forges (30/1), Izenha Du Pilet (40/1), J'aime En Vrai (45/1), Isis De Calvi (60/1), Have A Love (60/1), Jonction Haufor (75/1), Golden Square (100/1)

race_summary.name: H.H.Sri Chamaraja Wadiyar Memorial Cup Handicap

nextTenRaces.betting_forecast: She's So Beautiful (15/8), My Life My Rules (7/2), Isabelle (6/1), Phoenix Gold (6/1), Sienna Princess (6/1), Absolute Conquerer (8/1), Polar Wind (12/1), Flying Falcon (12/1), Aries Celestial (16/1), Planet Super (20/1), Glory Of Heaven (20/1), Major Saab (20/1)

owner.name: Mr T Sudeer Patel, Mrs Namratha B Salvi And Mr Raj Ramprasad Singh
Mr Deepak K Srivastava And Mr Prakash K Srivastava
